title: Sound Opinions Show
teaser: Jim and Greg dissect The Replacementsâ€™ classic album Let It Be in honor of the band getting back together after a 22 year hiatus.
description:
NEWS:
• Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot speak with the Canadian Polaris Prize founder Steve Jordan about the history of the prize and its influence on record sales. The winner is announced on September 23rd, 2013.
• This week’s feature has hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot performing a “Classic Album Dissection” of the Replacements’ classic album, “Let It Be.” Before they dive into the album, Jim and Greg discuss whether or not the band's recent reunion at RiotFest in Chicago, Toronto and Denver was a successful effort.
FEATURE:
Jim and Greg dissect The Replacements’ classic album “Let It Be” in honor of the band getting back together after a twenty two year hiatus. They are joined by Replacements biographer and Minneapolis journalist Jim Walsh. This interview was recorded at The Current.
DESERT ISLAND JUKEBOX:
Greg chooses a tune by the English “Pub Rocker” Graham Parker. 
YOUR SOUND OPINIONS:
 
At the end of the show we hear comments from listeners.
